dcterms:description: The Brain dataset is derived from a real-world fMRI brain scans dataset, where nodes represent brain tissues, and edges capture nodesâ€™ activation time similarity in the examined period. The goal is to predict the functionality of each node, which is one of the 10 categories.
dcterms:title: Brain10

dcterms:creator: Dongkuan Xu
Wei Cheng
Dongsheng Luo
Yameng Gu
Xinyu Liu
Jingchao Ni
Bo Zong
Haifeng Chen
Xiang Zhang
dcterms:description: The DBLP dataset is an extracted co-author network from the DBLP website, where nodes are authors and edges represent co-authorship relationships. The extracted authors are from 5 research areas, serving as class labels.
dcterms:title: DBLP5

dcterms:creator: William L. Hamilton
Rex Ying
Jure Leskovec
dcterms:description: The Reddit dataset is extracted from the Reddit platform, where nodes represent posts, and edges are constructed between nodes having similar keywords. The node attributes are word2vec representations of the comments of a post, and node labels correspond to one of the 4 communities or 'subreddits'.
dcterms:title: Reddit4

dcterms:creator: Jianfei Gao
Bruno Ribeiro
dcterms:description: The PeMS04 dataset represents traffic sensor networks in California, where each node symbolizes a road sensor, and the edge weights denote the geographical distance between two sensors. The dataset captures average traffic statistics over a 5-minute interval.
dcterms:title: PeMS04

dcterms:creator: Jianfei Gao
Bruno Ribeiro
dcterms:description: The PeMS08 dataset is similar to PeMS04, representing traffic sensor networks in California, capturing average traffic statistics over a 5-minute interval.
dcterms:title: PeMS08

dcterms:creator: Jianfei Gao
Bruno Ribeiro
dcterms:description: The England-COVID dataset is created by aggregating information from the mobility log released by Facebook for England. The nodes are cities, and the edges represent transportation statistics between them. The goal is to predict the infection rate of the next day.
dcterms:title: England-COVID
